title: Can we talk about Akali
body:
I didnt think she was too much of a problem until yesterday I played a game against her and the fact that her Twilight shroud is available so quickly makes her an unbelievable champion to deal with. There is not counter play to her Twilight shroud as you either have to sit there and take her damage or walk away and that is the frustrating part. Either way it is a big problem at least in my opinion and I thought abilities were supposed to have counterplay or weaknesses, but honestly there is never a bad time to use this ability and if it is off cooldown she can use it in any situation. to attack, run away, or poke you down. Either the CD for this ability needs to be increased or the duration needs to be tuned down. Another thing is the amount of time she is visible after an attack, she should probably be visible longer if she is willing to make a move in this shroud. I think these are all fair ways of making this ability much more balanced as I am not trying to gut the character, but there is not another champion that gets away with this kind of stealth and attack with the sustain she has. Walking away or sitting there and taking damage is not viable counter play and I think everyone can agree with that. What are your thoughts on the situation.

More Details:

The game I am talking about was my second to last game I played recently as Ekko (Ekko Main), and I got the first kill in lane due to jungle and akali trying to dive me. Although our jungle had a pretty Terrible game, I was ahead in farm and kills at the beginning and stlll unable to 1 v 1 Akali. Now the biggest problem with 1 v 1 on Akali and the Shroud is if you get her low and she uses it she can use her sustain to get herself up to a decent amount of health to come back at you which she should not get so much use of with her Twilight shroud.

Let me know what you think I would really like Opinions.

replies.body: She's qued for a rework soon.

That feel when she marks you > get Q proc BUT YOU STILL CAN'T ATTACK HER CAUSE SHE GETS INTO SHROUD SO QUICKLY!!!

Although riot is reworking her but i doubt it will be something good. They might put her shroud to have some flash powder... after they're gone she needs to buy them lul.

her W lasts 8 seconds, if she attacks you while she is in W range, she is revealed for 2 seconds.
after her W is gone, it goes on a 10 seconds cooldown, you got 10 seconds to take advantage of it
then, again, 8 seconds where she has her W.
then again 10 seconds when you are stronger than her

rise and repeat. But like 99% of the league community lacks patience or discipline

Revealed for 2 seconds? I wouldn't say it's 2 seconds lol. Everytimei played it was likie 1.3-1.5. Almost no time to even attack her.
Even without shroud she can still outdamage you by electrocite + Q proc+ after she gets hextech gunblade + after level 6. So yeah, fuck that champ.

>If Akali uses a basic attack or ability inside her smoke cover, she will reveal herself for 0.65 seconds.

that's on the wiki, weird, i was sure it was about 2 seconds.
however, you are right on this one apparently. Heh, and this comes from someone that mained akali for 2 seasons.

But usually to make up for this reveal time, Akali players will go in and out of W (walking outside its range and then getting back in), because when you do that, the invisibility triggers right away, so, you don't have to wait for the "timmer" to run out before you get back into invis.

Still the usual combo is: Q + wait until Q is up again + walk backward a bit + W forward + aa + q + aa + going back in your W

PS, you shouldn't say: "after she gets hextech gunblade + after level 6", there's no way Akali can get gunblade in the first 8-9 minutes unless her enemy is REALLY awful at this game. So, you'll always be lv 6+ when you complete gunblade.
But she does get a power spike at 6 and at {{item:3145}} 
However, she also starts to fall of after she finishes gunblade + zhonias + boots. If Akali is on equal gold or only 1-2 kills ahead at 3 items, she now falls behind in terms of what she brings to her team.
she's revealed for 0.65 seconds to be precise. Which is a time shorter than most non adc aa animations. So she gets pretty much free trades for the whole time in the shroud. It's pure BS.
That's why she is getting reworked , her pick rate is pretty low , so we have nothing to do but to wait the rework and hope that she isn't picked against us.

longest duration and lowest cooldown invis in the game (with an attached short ranged blink) on a champion who already has semi spammable high range mobility on ulty.  Yeah that akali rework can't come soon enough, obnoxious champ.  

The way you beat akali is let her be too greedy (bait her away from her shroud shortly after she uses it) so that you can target her to cc her and boom.

BUT this only works if the akali misplays so its hard to call it counterplay, very annoying champ design.
she is getting a rework. maybe she a bit more balanced after that

no i say they are more balanced AFTER the rework

{{champion:3}} is statistically worse by every metric than pre-rework. His play rate in top is now lower with a **9%** lower average win rate. His play rate in mid is now lower with nearly **5%** lower average win rate. His old flash-ult was cheap, but it wasn't necessarily a problem. Now they've turned him into yet another Shen/Kalista that is garbage outside of pro play.

{{champion:72}} now has a play rate that's *less than half* of what it was pre-rework, with lower performance across the board.

{{champion:35}} might be an improvement overall, but it took two seasons of follow-up with him yo-yoing between useless and broken. They also removed literally all of the counterplay to his stealth, so I fail to see how that made him healthier.

>  There is not counter play to her Twilight shroud

the counterplay is obvious, she is invisible, not invincible, you can hit her with spells, usually AOE spells and kill her outright, if your champion has some burst damage you can also wait for her to attack and attack back and finally, if your champion has neither AOE spell or burst damage, you can wait it out for when her shroud is on cooldown.

>  Another thing is the amount of time she is visible after an attack, she should probably be visible longer if she is willing to make a move in this shroud.

you have between 0.65 and 1 second to react and hit her back depending on what she does, it's more time than a lot of skill shots wind up animations. If you can dodge Ezreal Q, Malzahar Q, Thresh Q etc.. you are quick enough to hit Akali back.

> The game I am talking about was my second to last game I played recently as Ekko

That match-up tends to be a stalemate. You best chance is to wear her down with Q spam, shroud or not, take favourable trades with your W and once you hit 6 line up your R on her face, shroud or not, and one shot her, but it can be a bit tricky and then both players can also buy Zhonya Hourglass etc making the duel even more tricky.

Generally, any champion with good AOE or CC spells will win against Akali, and other champions with good burst can hold just fine if you are quick with your fingers. Ekko doesn't have that much AOE or CC but he isn't defenceless, it's a skill match-up, although again, chances are you won't be able to kill each other.

Playing against Akali is kind of straight forward, you throw your AOE spells into her shroud, and if your spells are on cooldown, you stay away from her shroud. And if you have CC spells, you save it for when she R you.

Akali isn't getting nerfed because she is simply not very good.
Odd to see everyone agreeing so far. they should at least nerf her Twilight shroud for now and it doesnt even have to be a heavy nerf just make it more manageable.

I had even rushed {{item:3123}} and an early {{item:1029}} since she was building her {{item:3144}} first, but it didn't help.
